Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre above two white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of hindquarters of goat (red patches on rump, side and leg remaining) to right; part of pendant triangle, elaborate rosette and trace of rising roundel as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 257, no. 472, pl. 65)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0508) (phase 2)
